channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Rubbish left in Street following Saturday Market, 13th October
item.description:
Bags of rubbish are left at the junction of North Cross Road and Archdale Road at the end of Saturday's market. These are not cleared - rubbish is only collected from the Lordship Lane end of North Cross Road. Foxes attack the rubbish and spread it all round the nearby pavements and gardens overnight on Saturday and Sunday - this morning the rubbish had still not been cleared

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8-9, North Cross Road, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Old mouldy bed and clothes dumped in fire escape of building, 13th October
item.description:
The mouldy bed appeared on the fire escape of the building on the top floor on Friday October 10th. Clothes have also been thrown out. On Monday 13th of October it was all still there, and what appeared to be human feces next to the bed.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Well Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing house bins, 13th October
item.description:

item.title: Urination, 13th October
item.description:
Somebody has urinated right on my doorstep, and also people are doing drugs in the stairways. Itâ€™s not a council property but the freeholder and management have abandoned the building and it is not safe now.

item.title: Bed, mattress and clothes, 13th October
item.description:
Neighbour has dumped this mouldy bed and a lot of clothes in the walkway. In fairness this is in protest at the horrible conditions of his flat, tbh e council is paying for this rent. The landlord should be in prison, disgusting.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Well Street, Hackney, London

item.title: Traffic signals detached from pole, 13th October
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dunstan Road, Golders Green, London

item.title: Wall between 291 and 295 West End Lane, 13th October
item.description:
Tall, opaque wall between NOX hotel (291) and The Black Lion Pub (295) blocks visibility, causing pedestrians to collide with people leaving NOX. This resulted in an accident on Sunday 5 October, where a woman was thrown to the ground and injured. Please consider requiring the fencing to be adjusted so that (a) it is made of a material that is somewhat see-through; (b) it is less tall, allowing people to be seen over the top of it; and/or (c) the fencing ends earlier so that people can see each other and avoid collision.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 295-297, West End Lane, West Hampstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped red car, 13th October
item.description:
This car appears to be abandoned on Melford rd - on corner of Underhill Road. . It is facing the wrong way on a one way street - it has a form on windscreen saying it has no tax. It now has a wheel clamp. It is blocking parking spaces so please can it be removed asap. It has been there for several weeks. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Underhill Road, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet
